passages.text: 1HFY25: weak underlying FCF with refinancing debt stack increasingly
1H25 EBITDA of US$159m 3% below our estimates while profit of
US$25m was a miss on our US$52m on higher tax and
interest. A\(0.015/sh\) dividend in line. Our base case remains that NIC
receives a lumpy +US\(100m VAT refund in CY26 (unchanged) and that**
NIC can refinance their debt stack by CY26 (new) to optimise
amortisation. With an underlying equity FCF loss this half and US$112m in
cash, liquidity would be stretched for the final two US$126.5m ENC
payments in 1HCY26. NIC has entered into a commitment letter for a
US$100m loan facility expected to finalise in Sep. Alternative debt funding options are been evaluated in parallel to optimise the capital structure.
NIC notes they have flex on the timing of the remaining ENC payments.
NIC's base case is that i) ENC generates positive cashflows from JanCY26
ii) RKAB permit for Hengjaya increase is received iii) debt is refinanced.

**Revisions, borrowings and conference call** — Our EBITDA is down 8% in CY26 after updating for the 1H result and lowering our NPI prices from CY25 by 2-3% which also sees FY26+ EBITDA down 2-5%. Our TP reduces by 10cps on lower earnings and the roll forward of our net debt. NIC has US$400m in unsecured notes due Oct'28, a US$350m 5yr senior bank facility plus a fully drawn US$50m RCF; and US$250m 5yr term loan. Covenants are disclosed on the bank facilities. On the conference call NIC noted that they expect the RKAB permit for i) 19Mtpa at Hengjaya expected in the coming months and ii) 6Mtpa at Sampala by end of the CY. NIC also noted they still expect the chunky VAT refund in 6-12months. We note ONI has not yet commenced receiving VAT refunds but the other projects have i.e. ANI received the 2022 VAT claim during the period.
Source: Company Reports and dataCentral, Citi

Bull/Bear: Nickel Industries Ltd
Multiple re- rate to 6x EV/EBITDA
Long- term nickel price of US\$7.70/lb, FX 0.75x Base case production and costs 1xP/NAV and 5x EV/EBITDA
NIC trades on 3.0x FY25e EV/EBITDA

Nickel Industries (NIC) is the largest listed pure- play nickel producer globally with an \(80\%\) economic interest in three operating RKEF plants in the Indonesian Morowali Industrial Park (IMIP) located in Indonesia, which produce Nickel Pig Iron (NPI), and one RKEF on Weda Bay. NIC also holds \(80\%\) in the nickel laterite operation Hengjaya, which provides a portion of ore feed to the IMIP and \(60\%\) of the Sampala project which we expect to commence production in mid- CY26. NIC has also diversified into Type 1 nickel and has produced matte when market conditions supported, and MHP from HPAL exposure. NIC holds a \(10\%\) stake in the 60ktpa HNC operating HPAL plant and will own \(55\%\) of the construction- stage 72ktpa ENC HPAL plant with production expected in 1HCY26. Stainless Steel producer Tsingshan through Shanghai Decent holds \(\sim 22.7\%\) of the register and United Tractors \(20\%\) .

We rate the stock Neutral / High Risk (2H). NIC is the only material ASX way to gain exposure to the nickel price, has a growth story, and is diversifying earnings to span Type 1 and Type 2 nickel. That said there is chunky cash inflows and outflows to come over the next 12m with the risk that the balance sheet becomes constrained. On balance, we see risks as evenly skewed. We assign a High Risk rating to reflect: i) operational, fiscal and counterparty risks associated with operating in Indonesia; ii) ramp- up risk; and iii) M&A risk.

Our target price of A \(0.80 is based on a blend of 1x NPV (A\) 0.90/sh) and 5x forward EV/EBITDA based on comparable industrial stocks in our coverage and adjusted for minorities. To derive a sum- of- the- parts NAV, we apply a real WACC of \(9.5\%\) to discounted cash flows to 2040E for the group's individual operations. We assume earnings from Hengjaya and the HPALs based upon our expectations of LME nickel, and earnings from the RKEFs based upon our NPI pricing expectations. Our long- term assumptions include US \(17,000/t (US\) 7.70/lb) nickel and US\) 13,860/t NPI. Our DCF valuation is net of cash.

We rate NIC as High Risk due to counterparty risk and sovereign risks associated with Indonesia. Additionally, there is execution risk associated with NIC's expansion plans. Group value is dependent on cash flows derived from its interest in the RKEF lines located in the IMIP controlled by major shareholder Tsingshan, as well as HPALs and adverse conditions could have a significant impact on group earnings. Key downside risks include: The company is exposed to macroeconomic developments affecting the nickel price and exchange rates, operational risks that might affect volumes and input costs, and political risks that might affect costs and the company's reputation. The fiscal regime has precedent for changing which could also impact NIC, as could the timing around VAT refund payments. Longer term, likely divergence of the market between type 1 and type 2 nickel, could see downside risk to our RKEF revenue forecast. Similiary, a move away from NMC battery technology could impact nickel demand flowing through to HPAL revenues. If the impact on the company from any of these factors proves to be greater than we anticipate, the stock will likely have difficulty achieving our target price. Likewise, if any of these factors proves to have less of an effect than we anticipate, the stock could outperform our target.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "-" and "-" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a

buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
